# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is a function `wrap_string` that wraps a string to a given text width:
```julia
function wrap_string(str::String, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(str)
    lines = String[]
    line = ""
    for word in words
        if length(line) + length(word) + 1 > text_width
            push!(lines, line)
            line = word
        else
            line = length(line) == 0 ? word : line * " " * word
        end
    end
    push!(lines, line)
    return join(lines, "\n")
end
```
Here is an example of using the function:
```julia
str = "This is a long string that needs to be wrapped to a maximum width of 10 characters."
wrapped_str = wrap_string(str)
println(wrapped_str)
```

